title: Freezes while composing message Thunderbird 138/139, Windows 11, in safe mode and troubleshoot mode SOLVED by setting accessibility.force_disabled to 1 (bug1972457)
creator: dlandiss1
content:
Thunderbird 138/139, Windows 11 Pro 23H2. While composing a message, after a few lines the app freezes. Both the compose window and the main TB window freeze. Only opening the Windows Task manager allows me to close them. This did not happen with earlier versions.

If I save the message every few seconds while composing I can get most of the message back and continue after restarting TB. This behavior is the same in both the normal and troubleshooting TB modes. I can't even find a crash log to send to Mozilla.

Where shall I look next?

Thank you!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird"]

title: how to re-order message filter entries - up/down -
creator: PS56k
content: how to re-order the actual email messaging filter entries ? Have a filter setup that currently has several entries for FROM and exact user Ids. Would like to create a new top entry with a SUBJECT CONTAINS entry. Only way I've found is to "+" at the top, but it creates a blank entry below the top entry. so - I dup the top entry as the 2nd entry, and then edit the top entry -
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0

title: Thunderbird has lost my email login credentials
creator: vk4cmr
content: When I clicked onto one of my gmail accounts, it did a "somersault", and shut down Thunderbird. Email is: vk4cmr@gmail.com Mark Chad Chatfield That was about 2.5 weeks ago. Tried almost everyday to work this out, Zilch. The email address in fault, is on 3 computers. 2 are still operational, But my Main Use computer will NOT go past the required credential check. Have deleted all reference to that email address and tried reinstalling back into Thunderbird, to NO avail. It still works on the sub-computer systems. I cannot find any relevant help files on yr Knowledge Base remotely connected to this problem. Please advise TIA. Mark
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: can't receive emails
creator: rtrice
content: Every time I try to sign into my email I get a message that says I can't sign in and to retry or cancel or something. I can see my emails on the ifiber page on the internet but not on my email computer. I also have some vision problems so it's difficult to troubleshoot on the computer. I'd appreciate any help you can give me.

title: Missing translation in the norwegian translation - Who to ask?
creator: LarsErikOsterud
content: I use Thunderbird in norwegian, and there is one small thing... "Mail" is translated to "E-post" everywhere EXCEPT the toolbar button (still say "Mail"). "Address Book" is translated to "Adressebok" everywhere EXCEPT the toolbar button (still says "Address Book"). Who do I contact to fix this, or is there somewhere (config file etc) where I can fix this myself?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: accounts
creator: pier3
content:
Hello, I have a new computer with windows 11 and set up thunderbird. I use Firefox as browser and tested some settings, dark and light modes. I finally set up 4 different accounts with different domain names, I tried some settings to have the same display with on my other computer with Windows 10. I played with some setting and now can"t bring back light mode. I,m more of a computer user not a wiz. same this happened on the Firefoz browser with boxes around each bookmarks toolbar ans tabs. Any suggestions? Thnak you,

Gian Piero
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Email Subfolders
creator: bill_lamb
content: I have numerous folders in my email account. Some folders have subfolders. I have one case where a folder has two subfolders, but when I expand to show the subfolders, only one subfolder is displayed. The main folder and both subfolders existed in my account before I installed Thunderbird.

title: Find Thunderbird version from Profile data
creator: joaquin.oakland
content:
(The topic is the closest I could pick from the dropdown.)

After a disaster last October appearing after a macOS update, I have been working to get back to where all is normal. Apple asked me to erase and reinstall macOS. I was using TBird (some struggles) right up to doing the erase. My question:

Is there some data in the backup ups of the profiles that identifies the TBird version that was last using the profile?

This might also help me: is there is some data in the .app files that identifies what version of TBird the Package "file" is for.

Thanks for your help.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0
